other.penalty:
A fine not exceeding level five on the standard scale

Time limit for prosecutions:
6 months

On the 12th March 2015 the limit on fines imposed by a Magistrates‚Äô court was removed ‚Äì as such, the potential fine on summary conviction in relation to an offence committed after this date is unlimited.

english.title: Fail    / refuse give assistance to person executing Communications Act search warrant
english.legislation: Contrary to section 366(8)(b) and    (9) of the Communications Act 2003.
english.pointstoprove:
date and location
intentionally
obstructed
a person authorised to execute a search warrant
issued under s.366 of the Communications Act 2003

additionalkeyword:
Possession or control of a television receiver
    without a licence

investigatoraction.description: Confirm proposed charge is appropriately authorised (Police or CPS)
Ensure compliance with investigator's obligations re disclosure
Consider if case suitable for referral to Financial Investigation Unit and CPS for asset recovery eg confiscation order

english.standardoffencewording: On **(..SPECIFY DATE..) at    **(..SPECIFY TOWNSHIP..), without reasonable excuse, failed to give assistance that you    were under a duty to give to a person authorised to execute a search warrant granted under    section 366 of the Communications Act 2003 by the **(..SPECIFY COURT..) on **(..SPECIFY    DATE OF SEARCH WARRANT..)
english.standardstatementoffacts: On **(..SPECIFY DATE..) at    **(..SPECIFY TOWNSHIP..) the defendant, without reasonable excuse, failed to give    assistance that you were under a duty to give to a person authorised to execute a search    warrant granted under section 366 of the Communications Act 2003 by the **(..SPECIFY    COURT..) **(..SPECIFY DATE OF SEARCH WARRANT..).

title: Possess a television set with intent to install / use without a licence
legislation: Contrary to section 363(3)(a) and (4) of the    Communications Act 2003.
